steps.title: Open windows/door.
steps.content: Open windows/door. You donâ€™t want to trigger the smoke detector.

steps.title: Clean coffee grinder, ceni, and the roasting pan.
steps.content: Clean coffee grinder, ceni, and the roasting pan. Any left over flavor from other foods will change the taste of the coffee.

steps.title: Wash the green coffee beans 3 times with water.
steps.content: Wash the green coffee beans 3 times with water.

steps.title: Turn on the stove top and set it to medium.
steps.content: Turn on the stove top and set it to medium.

steps.title: Place the washed coffee beans on the coffee pan and start.
steps.content: Place the washed coffee beans on the coffee pan and start.

steps.title: Continuously move your hand back and forth while holding the pan for 10 minutes.
steps.content: Continuously move your hand back and forth while holding the pan for 10 minutes. You want to make sure all the beans are roasted equally. Never leave the coffee on the oven top while the gas is still on. The coffee beans will get burnt, and the taste of the coffee will be bitter.

steps.title: When all of the coffee beans have turned dark golden brown, take them off the stovetop.
steps.content: When all of the coffee beans have turned dark golden brown, take them off the stovetop.

steps.title: Take the pan to everyone in the house so that they can smell the sweet smell of roasted coffee beans.
steps.content: Take the pan to everyone in the house so that they can smell the sweet smell of roasted coffee beans. This is customary in Ethiopian culture.

steps.title: Place the pan with the roasted coffee beans in a place where it can cool at room temperature (takes~5 minutes).
steps.content: Place the pan with the roasted coffee beans in a place where it can cool at room temperature (takes~5 minutes).

steps.title: Grind the roasted coffee beans using the coffee grinder.
steps.content: Grind the roasted coffee beans using the coffee grinder.

steps.title: Pour 2 cups of water into the gebena.
steps.content: Pour 2 cups of water into the gebena.

steps.title: Add the grinded coffee into the gebena.
steps.content: Add the grinded coffee into the gebena.

steps.title: Set the stovetop to medium heat.
steps.content: Set the stovetop to medium heat.

steps.title: Let the gebena sit on the stove for 10 minutes.
steps.content: Let the gebena sit on the stove for 10 minutes.

steps.title: Turn off the gas as the coffee rises above the top of the gebena.
steps.content: Turn off the gas as the coffee rises above the top of the gebena.

steps.title: Place the gebena slanted, so the grounded coffee can settle down into the bottom layer.
steps.content: Place the gebena slanted, so the grounded coffee can settle down into the bottom layer. Be careful not to move the gebena once placed; moving can cause the bottom layer of grounded coffee to be mixed with the top layer of your coffee.

steps.title: Place the cines on a serving board.
steps.content: Place the cines on a serving board.

steps.title: Pour the coffee from the gebena into the cines.
steps.content: Pour the coffee from the gebena into the cines. Serve them to your friends and family.

steps.title: Add sugar or salt to their coffee, based on your preference.
steps.content: Add sugar or salt to their coffee, based on your preference.
